reviews.review_msg: Avoid this professor. There were no helpful lectures, just reading from her script. The questions she asks in class or for your writing are so confusing, and she doesn't know how to help you. On the other hand, she is a very tough grader, and her expectations are so high, despite her low teaching quality. Her class is extremely boring.

She makes lectures mandatory but they offer nothing of substance to your learning. Not only are they boring and useless, but your passing of this course is dependent on you showing up even if you have handed in all your work and did decently on them, which is absurd. Content is presented in a confusing way and her explanations of them do nothing.

The lectures are long, boring, and usually leaves you confused. Her tone is monotonous when she reads off her script and slides aren't really easy to understand unless you've done the readings. She speaks with unnecessarily complex language and so does the readings she chooses, so it's easy to get confused no matter how much she explains concepts.

Genuinely the worst professor I've had at SFU. Lectures are boring and confusing, she does not follow her own marking criteria (will take off marks for things she never outlined in her posted criteria), so you never know what she wants from you. Also inaccessible because she will brush you off when you try to question her about her marking. Avoid!

Her seminars are very monotone and hard to follow because she reads her script, which uses difficult language to explain new concepts. So she is really not a great presenter and it took me some time to get a hang of the concepts. She does try to make it engaging with in-class activities, student presentations, and encouraging critical thinking.

The lectures are so dry and hard to understand. She uses the most complicated words to explain the simplest ideas and it literally just made me even more confused. Lots of readings, but some of them I have no idea how it relates to the module. Also have no idea what to expect from the exam (that worths 40%) as there are like no sample questions.

I prefer better business communication. The lecture is dreadful and keeping students engaged is good but it shouldn't be so often and there should be a promotion of answers leading to the one that she/her wants.
Good luck lol

When I tell you I have never seen a prof this disorganized... boy do I mean it. Her grading criteria is super vague and she always expects more than what the question asked for. Assignments are not correctly set up so it took us 4 weeks to hand in ONE of them. Uses big words to explain the simplest ideas and somehow fails to get them across. AVOID

She is one of the kindest and passionate profs I have seen in SFU for a while. She genuinely cares about her students and accepts every opinion during the class discussion. I really feel she is under-rated and more students should take her class to understand her perspective. I would love to take another class with Deborah again!

Debrorah is a really sweet woman and she tries her best to be a great prof. Her grading is pretty fair but there was a decent amount of work, since it was online we had to do discussion posts and blog posts almost everyweek - although she cancelled a lot this semester (summer 2020). I wouldn't say she is my favourite prof but I would take her again

Super easy course and she's a great prof! lots of writing and reading but it is a W course, she definitely cares about her students and is always down to help and is super understanding. she replies super quickly thru email too! you don't really need to attend lectures but definitely keep up with the course schedule if you don't attend

For the mid term, the expectations were not clear at all. She expected so much more for every answer than what the question asked so make sure you write more than you think you need. Pretty boring class, she seemed to care but was couldn't get the class engaged at all. Discussion questions every week and lots of readings.

She's great! it's an online course for me and she canceled discussion posts if she thought we were being overwhelmed. 2 papers both 500-600 words. She provided all the articles on the SFU library reserve. A small media presentation was super easy. Fair marker. The midterm was written and you have to have read the articles and watched the films.

Had to take this class online and I would like to believe that is why the class was so difficult. It's a 100 level class and she still decided to make it hard to understand her or her assignments. All topics are super vague and she's never specific in what she wants. Kinda wish I never took the course!

This professor is a bit dry but that's not the biggest problem with her. She refuses to help and try to put everything on the ta and her ta nadira is not helpful and seem like she hates everyone when she teaches. Deborah's test are not fair . She will ask you for an example and expect you to explain everything but she didn't specify it. Overall bad

I never write reviews but I had to for Deborah. She is the hardest marker I have ever encountered. SA 100W is interesting but she makes it so dull and somehow finds a way to give you bad marks. She isn't clear with what she expects from assignments and marks extra hard on top of it. DO NOT TAKE IF YOU DONT NEED THIS CLASS & DONT TAKE IF SHES THE TA

If you're reading these reviews looking for a sign of whether or not to take SA 358, unless its absolutely mandatory, DONT take it! Readings were super heavy, assignments were graded very tough by TA (marks were inconsistent). I wish I hadn't taken this course, her prerecorded lectures were very dry, and the course material is very challenging

Did not enjoy my time in this prof's class, lectures were dry and the assigments were tedious. The course content could be really interesting but the way it is taught makes it super boring. My least favourite thing was the assignments, they didn't add to the course material in a meaningful way and were mostly just a bore to complete.

Took an online course with her. It wasn't organized that well and the prerecorded lectures were very dry and wordy (she talks fast btw, so good luck taking notes). Reading was heavy and didn't relate to assignments--would have done just as well if I had read nothing the whole semester. Overall an "ok" course. Mark depends on who you get for a TM.

Ta's mark super hard for a 100 lvl class. They expect you to write like doctor's which us unfair. The course material is straight forward and simple, mostly common sense, but the way they mark kills your GPA.

Good prof, willing to work with students so they can get the most out of the material. Participating in class will absolutely help you in the long run. Open book midterm so annotate your textbook and take detailed notes!

For a writing course, I found it to be surprisingly easy. 4 papers in total; the longest were merely 600 words max. Course concepts are straightforward, but lectures were dull as she read mostly off of the slides. Tutorial readings were challenging at times but she was quite good with clarification. Final was a breeze with no surprises at all.
Took this class thinking it would be interesting and easy but Deborah is so boring and marks harder then is necessary.

The class itself could be better if she explained the content in an easier way to understand. For a first year class it's quite difficult. Her PowerPoints don't have much information on it so its hard to grasp concepts and there's no textbooks for clarification. She's a very critical marker so make sure your writing is clear and concise

Debbie is a quiet yet firm  leader. Some may find her lectures to be  dull, but she makes the effort to make the subject matter relatable and will draw on her own life to do so. She truly cares about her students and their success, and tries to create a classroom environment where everyone has the opportunity to participate in discussion.

Caring, approachable, passionate about the topic, and fair. I appreciate Deborah's approach to teaching- she certainly stands out amongst the rest. She's comfortable and confident in her gentleness, and incredibly diplomatic. Fair grader, interesting group discussions and lectures. Assignments could use more instruction.

I personally found the class to be boring. Assignments were not explained properly and the notes were mostly just pictures. Her marking was very subjective, making it difficult to write my papers exactly the way she wants.
Very interesting. All of the students engaged.  I don't think anyone dropped out. Do your work, participate, ask questions and you will do well.

Class with Debbie is fun. The material is really engaging. She is very softspoken and shy, but polite and caring. She mixes class up with lecture/discussion/film and is very interested in the material as well. She incorporates student questions into next week's lecture--very in tune with our needs. I appreciate Debbie a lot as an instructor.
